chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
order: A -> A -> Prop
order_trans: forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c

Goal:
(forall a b : A, order a b -> order b a -> a = b) -> forall l1 l2 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> ordered l1 -> ordered l2 -> l1 = l2

Premises:
Inductive ordered : list A -> Prop := ordered_nil : ordered [] | ordered_one : forall a : A, ordered [a] | ordered_cons : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered (b :: l) -> ordered (a :: b :: l) Arguments ordered _%list_scope Arguments ordered_cons _ _ _%list_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
permutation : forall A : Type, list A -> list A -> Prop
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, In a ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type] ?B : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type] ?f : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [A : Type order : A -> A ->...-> order a c |- list ?A]
VectorDef.to_list : VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> list ?A where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type] ?n : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- nat]
right : ?B -> {?A} + {?B} where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Prop] ?B : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Prop]
snd : ?A * ?B -> ?B where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type] ?B : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
left : ?A -> {?A} + {?B} where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Prop] ?B : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Prop]
inleft : ?A -> ?A + {?B} where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type] ?B : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Prop]
fst : ?A * ?B -> ?A where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type] ?B : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
inright : ?B -> ?A + {?B} where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type] ?B : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Prop]
pair : ?A -> ?B -> ?A * ?B where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type] ?B : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
ordered_trans_app : forall (a b : A) (l1 l2 : list A), ordered (l1 ++ l2) -> In a l1 -> In b l2 -> order a b
[] : list ?A where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
cons : ?A -> list ?A -> list ?A where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
None : option ?A where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
Some : ?A -> option ?A where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
VectorSpec.to_list_of_list_opp : forall l : list ?A, VectorDef.to_list (VectorDef.of_list l) = l where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
VectorDef.of_list : forall l : list ?A, VectorDef.t ?A (length l) where ?A : [A : Type order : A -> A -> Prop order_trans : forall a b c : A, order a b -> order b c -> order a c |- Type]
ordered_ind : forall P : list A -> Prop, P [] -> (forall a : A, P [a]) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered (b :: l) -> P (b :: l) -> P (a :: b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ordered l -> P l
ordered_sind : forall P : list A -> SProp, P [] -> (forall a : A, P [a]) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered (b :: l) -> P (b :: l) -> P (a :: b :: l)) -> forall l : list A, ordered l -> P l
ordered_trans : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), ordered (a :: l) -> In b l -> order a b
ordered_cons : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered (b :: l) -> ordered (a :: b :: l)
ordered_inv_order : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), ordered (a :: b :: l) -> order a b
Inductive ordered : list A -> Prop := ordered_nil : ordered [] | ordered_one : forall a : A, ordered [a] | ordered_cons : forall (a b : A) (l : list A), order a b -> ordered (b :: l) -> ordered (a :: b :: l) Arguments ordered _%list_scope Arguments ordered_cons _ _ _%list_scope
permutation_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P [] [] -> (forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l2 l1 -> P l2 l1 -> P (a :: l2) (a :: l1)) -> (forall (a b : A) (l : list A), P (a :: b :: l) (b :: a :: l)) -> (forall l1 l2 l3 : list A, permutation l1 l2 -> P l1 l2 -> permutation l2 l3 -> P l2 l3 -> P l1 l3) -> forall l l0 : list A, permutation l l0 -> P l l0
permutation_dec : forall A : Type, (forall a b : A, {a = b} + {a <> b}) -> forall l1 l2 : list A, {permutation l1 l2} + {~ permutation l1 l2}
app_inv_app2 : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 l3 l4 : list A) (a b : A), l1 ++ l2 = l3 ++ a :: b :: l4 -> (exists l5 : list A, l1 = l3 ++ a :: b :: l5) \/ (exists l5 : list A, l2 = l5 ++ a :: b :: l4) \/ l1 = l3 ++ [a] /\ l2 = b :: l4
permutation_one_inv_aux : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l1 l2 -> forall a : A, l1 = [a] -> l2 = [a]
fold_left_permutation : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B -> A), (forall (a : A) (b1 b2 : B), f (f a b1) b2 = f (f a b2) b1) -> forall (a : A) (l1 l2 : list B), permutation l1 l2 -> fold_left f l1 a = fold_left f l2 a
permutation_cons_ex_aux : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), permutation l1 l2 -> forall l11 l12 : list A, l1 = l11 ++ a :: l12 -> exists l3 l4 : list A, l2 = l3 ++ a :: l4 /\ permutation (l11 ++ l12) (l3 ++ l4)
find_min_correct : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (l : list A), match find_min f l with | Some (a, b) => (In b l /\ a = f b) /\ (forall c : A, In c l -> f b <= f c) | None => l = [] end
